00050 /// String describing quant method
00051 #define QUANTBIRDSEEDV2 "birdseed-v2"
00052 
00053 class QuantBirdseedv2 : public QuantBirdseed {
00054 
00055   public:
00056 
00057     /** 
00058      * What version of the BRLMM algorithm are we implementing?
00059      * @return version string.
00060      */
00061     std::string getVersion() {
00062         return "2.4";
00063     }
00064 
00065     /** Constructor, currently creates prior estimates from pre-calculated data from R. */
00066     QuantBirdseedv2(double confidenceThreshold, double correctionFactor): QuantBirdseed(confidenceThreshold, correctionFactor)
00067     {
00068         setupSelfDoc(*this);
00069 
00070         setOptValue("correction-factor", ToStr(m_CorrectionFactor));
00071         setOptValue("conf-threshold", ToStr(m_ConfidenceThreshold));
00072 
00073     }
00074 
00075     ~QuantBirdseedv2()
00076     {
00077     }
00078         
00079     /** Fill in our self documentation from current state. */
00080     static void setupSelfDoc(SelfDoc &doc) {
00081         doc.setDocName(QUANTBIRDSEEDV2);
00082         doc.setDocDescription("Do genotyping calls using the Birdseed v2 algorithm.");
00083         doc.setDocOptions(getDefaultDocOptions());
00084     }
00085   
00086     /** 
00087      * @brief Do the heavy lifting of estimation.
00088      */
00089     void computeEstimate();
00090 
00091 
00092     /** 
00093      * @brief What is the name of the quantification method?
00094      * @return name of adjuster.
00095      */  
00096     std::string getType() {
00097         return std::string(QUANTBIRDSEEDV2);
00098     }
00099 
00100 
00101     /** 
00102      * @brief Default Getter method for parameters and their documentation.
00103      * @return map of parameters and their descriptions.
00104      */
00105     static std::vector<SelfDoc::Opt> getDefaultDocOptions();
00106 
00107     /** 
00108      * @brief Supply a little how/what/why about the algorithms this
00109      * class performs and what parameters it takes.
00110      * @return SelfDoc
00111      */
00112     static SelfDoc explainSelf();
00113 
00114     /** 
00115      * @brief This static function should be overridden by child classes
00116      * to return an object of the correct type initialized correctly
00117      * with the parameters in the string, string map. All objects
00118      * created this way should be deleted when finished using.
00119      * 
00120      * @param param - Map of key/value pairs to initialize the object.
00121      * 
00122      * @return Pointer toCreate object, this should be sub casted as necessary.
00123      */
00124     static SelfCreate *newObject(std::map<std::string,std::string> &param);
00125   
00126     /** 
00127      * How many genotyping calls do we have? Also indicates how many
00128      * samples there are.
00129      *
00130      * @return Number of genotyping calls made.
00131      */
00132     inline size_t getNumCalls() { return m_Calls.size(); }
00133 
00134     /** 
00135      * Get our confidence value for a particular call in a particular sample.
00136      * @param index - sample of interest.
00137      * @return - Confidence in the predicted call.
00138      */
00139     double getConfidence(unsigned int index) { 
00140         if(index >= m_Confidences.size()) {
00141             Err::errAbort("Asking for call at index " + ToStr(index) + " when Probeset " + 
00142                           m_ProbesetName + " has only " + ToStr(m_Confidences.size()) + " calls.");
00143         }
00144         return m_Confidences[index];
00145     }
00146 
00147     /** 
00148      * Get our confidence value for a particular call in a particular sample.
00149      * @param genoType -  Genotype of interest.
00150      * @param index - sample of interest.
00151      * @return - Confidence in the predicted call.
00152      */
00153     double getConfGenotype(affx::GType genoType, unsigned int index) {
00154         assert(index < m_Distances.size());
00155         if(genoType == affx::NN) 
00156             return FLT_MAX;
00157         return m_Distances[index][genoType];
00158     }
00159 
00160     /** 
00161      * Get the summary value after transformation for the A and B alleles respectively.
00162      * 
00163      * @param index - Which chip to get values for.
00164      * @param aValue - Filled in with transformed a value.
00165      * @param bValue - Filled in with transformed b value.
00166      */
00167     void getAlleleValues(unsigned int index, double &aValue, double &bValue) {
00168         assert(index < m_AValues.size());
00169         assert(m_AValues.size() == m_BValues.size());
00170         aValue = m_AValues[index];
00171         bValue = m_BValues[index];
00172     }
00173 
00174     /** 
00175     * Get the summary value names for the A and B alleles respectively.
00176     * 
00177     * @param aName - Filled in with a value name.
00178     * @param bName - Filled in with b value name.
00179     */
00180     void getAlleleValueNames(std::string &aName, std::string &bName)
00181     {
00182         aName = "Signal A";
00183         bName = "Signal B";
00184     }
00185 
00186     /** 
00187      * Get the name of the probeset that these calls are being made for. 
00188      * @return name of probeset.
00189      */
00190     const std::string &getProbeSetName() { return m_ProbesetName; }
00191 
00192     /** 
00193      * Add an expression reporter to output the summary values for each
00194      * allele, residuals, etc.
00195      * 
00196      * @param reporter - the object that will output all summary values.
00197      */
00198     void addExprReporter(QuantMethodReport *reporter) {
00199         m_Reporters.push_back(reporter);
00200     }
00201 
00202     /* Set the quantification method to use for summarizing individual alleles */
00203     void setQuantExprMethod(QuantExprMethod *qMethod) {
00204         m_QuantMethod = qMethod;
00205     }
00206     /* Get the quantification method to use for summarizing individual alleles */
00207     QuantExprMethod *getQuantExprMethod() {
00208         return m_QuantMethod;
00209     }
00210 
00211     double getConfidenceThreshold(){ return(m_ConfidenceThreshold);};
00212         void setConfidenceThreshold(double v){m_ConfidenceThreshold=v;};
00213 
00214   // We should test for the format of the file here.
00215   void setPriorFile(const std::string& priorsPath, const string &chipType, 
00216                     std::set<const char *, Util::ltstr> *probeSetsToLoad, 
00217                     const std::map<std::string, std::pair< int, int > > &specialSnps);
00218 
00219   void setVerbosity(int v)
00220   {
00221     verbosity = v;
00222   }
00223    
00224 //   void setClusterOutFile(const std::string& clusterOutPath)

00226 //     m_ClusterOutFile = clusterOutPath;

00228 //   }
00229     
00230   double getMinThresh() { return -DBL_MAX;}
00231   double getMaxThresh() { return m_ConfidenceThreshold;}
00232 
00233   virtual bool finish() {
00234       bool result = true;
00235       if (m_ClusterOstrm.get() != NULL) {
00236           Fs::carefulClose(*m_ClusterOstrm);
00237       }
00238 
00239       for(size_t i=0; i<m_Reporters.size(); i++)
00240           result = result && m_Reporters[i]->finish(*this);
00241       return result;
00242   }
00243 };
